text: Texas Primary results are still coming in, but I want to again thank the incredible supporters who powered us to a first place finish. Y'all stepped up in a big way to put our campaign in this strong position, and I'm so grateful. Loved celebrating with many of you last night!

I’m not a career politician. I’m one of millions of Texans who have seen the world we’re giving our children and thought “hell no.” We built our campaign from the ground up together & proved we have what it takes to do something incredible in November: WIN Texas. That starts now. The Texas Primary was the first major test of the powerful grassroots campaign we’ve built. Results are still rolling in, but we’re confident that we’re advancing to the runoff, and we are ready to hit the ground running.  Thank you to every candidate who stepped up to champion their ideas and values. This talented and dynamic field showed that folks across Texas have high hopes for our future. I look forward to working with all of you to move the needle on our Texas values. Our momentum is unparalleled in this race. We’ve met thousands of Texans as we’ve traveled tens of thousands of miles across our great state, earned endorsements from many editorial boards and organizations, and raised more than $4 million from 35,000 donors. This runoff will be hard-fought, but I’ve taken on tough fights my whole life. When I was shot down & fought the Taliban, when I took on the Pentagon to open ground combat roles to women, & when I fought for my life during childbirth I prevailed. Together, we WILL win this one. We have to. If we want to take action on climate change, expand and improve health care, defend reproductive rights, end the gun violence epidemic, pass immigration reform and more — we must win this seat. Our focus is the ultimate goal: defeating an 18-year Senator who’s sold out Texans’ health, safety, and security to special interests, political bosses, and corporate donors. Ours is the only campaign that has what it takes, and this runoff is our opportunity to prove it. So let’s celebrate tonight and get right back to work tomorrow, because we’ve got a message for Sen. Cornyn: pack it up, buttercup, because the people of Texas are coming to take back our Senate seat.  Pitch in to help: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/mjh_twitter?refcode=20200302_primarynight&amount=10

Already voted? We still need you today! Make an even bigger difference in this election by reaching out to folks across Texas, telling them why you're part of this team, and getting them to the polls!  Our team is talking to voters all day long. Sign up! mobilize.us/mjfortexas/?is_virtual=true

Rise & shine, y’all. Polls are OPEN.‬ ‪This is the only campaign with the grit & grassroots power to defeat Sen. Cornyn — but we have to work together every step of the way.‬ ‪So go vote, tell 3 friends, & comment with your I Voted sticker to inspire others! mjfortexas.com/voting‬

There's no better way to celebrate Texas Independence Day than by making a plan to vote! Here in Texas we value strength and independence, but we've got a Senator who bows to his political bosses. Together, we can replace him. Make your plan to vote tomorrow ⬇️ mjfortexas.com/voting

San Antonio is full of badass women, and I was so thankful to Lt. Col. Martha Spinks for the warm introduction at our San Antonio Meet & Greet. I got to meet some incredible Texans and one young lady who is counting on us to fight for her future!

Today I dropped by our phone bank in Plano to thank our #TeamMJ volunteers for their support. With the primary on Tuesday, they’re working hard to get voters to the polls — and I’m so grateful to everyone who is dedicating time, dollars, and support to this campaign.

Thank you to the San Antonio Central Labor Council for having me at your Get Out the Vote canvass launch! Y’all are out there every day to protect workers’ rights across this country, and I am honored to be in this fight against greed and corruption with you.

‪This is our LAST weekend of action before the primary, so I need your help reaching folks all across Texas before they cast their votes! Texas is the BIGGEST battleground state, and I need you with me to win it.  Sign up to help get out the vote ➡️ mjfortexas.com/events‬

Today is the last day to early vote, and we’re just four days until the primary. Here’s your checklist: ✅ Vote early today! ✅ Sign up to volunteer this weekend ✅ Make sure your friends and family vote on Tuesday Find out everything you need to vote here: mjfortexas.com/voting

‪Every conversation I have on the trail reminds me why I’m doing this: the son who has been waiting 15 years for disability assistance, the veteran who emigrated from El Salvador and served our country, and the little girls who wanted to know what it’s like to fly a helicopter.‬

IBEW gave me important insight about the updates to our electrical grid we'll need in our transition to green energy. Today, I'm proud that IBEW Local 66 is standing with my campaign and endorsing me in this election.

‪It was fantastic to see so many fired up people getting out there to talk to voters at a canvass kickoff this weekend with North Austin Blue Action Dems! If you couldn't make it, don’t worry -- we have more events coming up! Sign up to join us: mjfortexas.com/events‬

Thanks to the volunteers who participated in our first Virtual Day of Action on Tuesday. With your help, we spread the word about this campaign to thousands of Texans! We're making calls, texting, and knocking doors all weekend. Sign up for a shift ⬇️ mjfortexas.com/events

Thank you to the Meyerland Area Democrats Club and Harris County Dems (and some of their littlest members!) for having me to talk about my plans to fight climate change and to clean up Washington. Everywhere I go, I meet folks who are fired up to send some Texas values to Washington!

Proud to earn the endorsement of The El Paso Times in the Democratic primary on March 3rd!  https://www.elpasotimes.com/story/news/politics/elections/2020/02/19/early-voting-2020-primary-election-el-paso-times-candidate-endorsements/4725037002/

Thank you to all who came out to the Buffalo Soldier Museum in Houston and shared their thoughts about how we can improve the VA and better support our veterans and their families. I'm grateful for your input, and I'll fight alongside you to make good on our promises to our veterans.

Tune in tonight to hear more about my plans to fight climate change, protect and improve our healthcare, and clean up our government!  Watch live on KVUE Austin or tune in to the live steam online at 6:30 CT! Find out how to watch here:   https://www.kvue.com/article/news/politics/vote-texas/us-senate-debate-democrat-candidates-against-john-cornyn-kvue-texas-tribune-kut/269-0e67674f-0f0d-4f32-a596-8051280b6447
It's a big day, Texas: early voting begins in the Democratic Primary! Find your nearest early voting location at mytexasvotes.com and make sure your friends and family get out and vote too!

Hey Texas! Polls open TODAY for early voting in the Democratic primary. Can I count on y'all to dedicate 30 min (or more!) during our virtual day of action? Help us reach as many Texans as possible as voters make their voices heard across Texas! Let’s GOTV! mobilize.us/mjfortexas/event/238941/‬
Thank you for the warm welcome, McAllen. I loved meeting the McAllen Moms Demand Action chapter, as well as student leaders and first time voters!
Got weekend plans? I'd love to see you out on the campaign trail! 🚗Tyler with the Texas Young Democrats 🚗Frisco with Jennifer Skidonenko 🚗East Dallas 🚗Lake Travis Sign up at mjfortexas.com/events

I'm thrilled to be endorsed by Transport Workers Union Local 260! I'll stand with Transport Workers Union (TWU) to protect the right to organize, defend safe working conditions, and advocate for fair wages. Workers rights are personal to me, and I'm grateful to have earned TWU's trust.

It won't be easy to beat a three-term senator, but it’ll be a cakewalk compared to three tours in combat. Now, I get two little kids ready every morning, so believe me when I say I can take on a career politician. Saddle up, and let's win this together ▶️ mjfortexas.com

I'm proud to be endorsed by Giffords in our fight to end the gun violence epidemic. I'll always stand up for Texans against the gun lobby, because I can’t allow our communities — our schools, movie theaters, and parks — to become war zones.

Texas is ready to send a fighter to DC, and we’re building the campaign we need to make it happen! Thank you to the 29,452 of you who have supported our campaign so far. https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/politics/texas/article/Democrat-MJ-Hegar-raises-another-1-1M-leading-15010367.php

I'm excited to share how I'll fight for workers' rights, affordable health care, action on climate change, and more as your next Senator from Texas! Follow along with the AFL-CIO's primary debate in Austin here:LIVE: U.S. Senate Debate

Thank you to Moms Demand Action - TX in Houston for sitting down with me. After losing a student in a shooting at nearby Bellaire High School last week, it couldn't be more clear that we need action NOW to protect our children from gun violence.

Hey folks in the Fort Bend area! Tomorrow is the last day to early vote for Dr. Eliz Markowitz for Texas State Representative - House District 28. We need this badass woman in the Texas house! Find the information you need here and don’t forget to get out and vote: https://www.eliz4tx.com/vote‬

While we still have far to go to reach true equality, we have Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. to thank for leading so much of the progress that's been made, and for challenging so many to imagine a better world. We honor him today by marching and every day by working toward the world he envisioned.

I had a great time Sunday at our meet & greet in West Lake Hills answering questions and talking about gun safety, immigration policy, and how to support a strong middle class in Texas. Love family friendly campaign events & seeing kids getting engaged in important conversations!
Thanks to everyone who asked questions and shared your thoughts at our Meet and Greet in Austin last night. It was great to see so many veterans, teachers, and young people!
Merch alert 🚨 Bumper stickers, hoodies, and t-shirts are now available! Get ready for 2020 with your Team MJ gear here: https://store.mjfortexas.com/
It's the first day of 2020, the year when everything changes! We're fired up and ready to fight for a better future here in Texas, and I'm so glad we're in it together. Let's get to work! 💪🏼

Two years after John Cornyn voted for the 2017 tax bill, what are the results? ➡️He handed corporate donors a HUGE tax break. ➡️They laid off employees, lined their pockets, and thanked him with campaign cash. ➡️Texans still work multiple jobs to afford health care and feed our kids.

I’m excited to join The Texas Tribune for a discussion with co-founder and CEO Evan Smith tomorrow morning – you can tune into the conversation here at 8 a.m. CST:  https://livestream.com/texastribune/events/8877776
It's official! I'm a candidate for U.S. Senate. Together, we've already accomplished so much. I know we can win this race if we're in it together. Join our team ➡️ mjfortexas.com

I'm on my way right now to officially file to run for U.S. Senate! I will beat John Cornyn next year, but I CANNOT do it without you. We're setting a filing day goal to raise $10,000 to build our campaign team. Can you pitch in a few bucks now to help? https://secure.actblue.com/donate/mjh_facebook?refcode=20191208_filing&amount=10

Protecting the right to vote should be a bipartisan priority. I hope the Senate will do the right thing and pass this bill to ensure folks across the country can participate in our democracy.  https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/06/us/politics/house-voting-rights.html?smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytimes

"U.S. Sens. Cornyn and Cruz together retweeted three early news reports, with Cornyn adding, 'Prayers for everyone affected.'" "'Where are you?' Trahan asked, rhetorically. '...We are the people that vote for you...I just want to see someone' showing concern." https://www.beaumontenterprise.com/news/article/In-Port-Neches-life-goes-on-but-questions-linger-14872909.php

This is dangerous. Our state has experienced multiple chemical disasters, including recently in Port Neches. We should be working to prevent them, not rolling back important protections. Every Texan has the right to a safe and healthy environment.  https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/EPA-rolls-back-regulations-written-after-West-14853861.php#

I’m thankful for my two sweet boys, my husband who makes life so much fun, and my cuddly dogs. I'm also grateful to all those working in their own ways to make our country the best it can be. Wishing you and yours a happy Thanksgiving celebration!

Folks, meet Baxter. We are so excited to add another furball to our family! Baxter had three broken ribs, a skull injury, and a broken paw. We're grateful to the folks at Wee Rescue who nursed him back to health so he could become a Hegar! Check them out if you're looking for a furry family member of your own: weerescue.org

I’m inspired by @MomsDemand and grateful for the chance to sit down with members in San Marcos. We urgently need gun safety legislation to enact universal background checks and stop selling weapons of war to civilians — which an overwhelming majority of Texans already support.

I’ve had two difficult pregnancies - I’m so glad the government wasn’t standing between me and my doctor during very personal conversations. I support access to reproductive health care for all Texans, and I'll always fight for a woman’s right to choose. https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2019/11/18/741117422/for-supporters-of-abortion-access-troubling-trends-in-texas

First: John Cornyn voted to enable a phony emergency declaration Then: His vote allowed his DC allies to steal money from TX military bases Now: The administration is using that money to seize land from Texans to build an ineffective border wall John Cornyn is selling out Texans. Literally. https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/immigration/trump-admin-preparing-take-over-private-land-border-wall-n1082316

‪Here's the deal: no matter who the next president is, they won't be able to enact universal background checks, tackle climate change, or pass immigration reform without a new Senate. The path to that new Senate runs through Texas.‬ ‪Pitch in! ⬇️ https://secure.actblue.com/donate/mjh_facebook?refcode=20191120_Debate&amount=10‬

‪It's unacceptable that Texas has the most uninsured kids in the US. I’ve had to rush my bleeding child to the hospital during an emergency, and NO parent should have to add worry over cost of care to a crisis like that.  https://www.expressnews.com/opinion/editorials/article/Editorial-Texas-legislature-must-stop-leaving-14839031.php‬

I enjoyed touring the North Texas Carpenters and Millwrights Training Center in Arlington! We talked about improving workplace safety standards, building strong unions, and the Helmets to Hardhats program for veterans. Thank you for having me!

“As a Medevac Pilot who flew wildfire suppressions, the metaphor I always think about is trying to find the biggest water bucket I can and dump it on the biggest fire. John Cornyn has got to go and is really hurting Texas. That’s where I see the fire right now."  I sat down with KXAN for the State of Texas show to talk about taking on Sen. Cornyn, the grassroots-powered campaign we're building, and the things that matter to Texans like health care, gun violence, and more. Give it a watch. ⬇️ https://www.kxan.com/state-of-texas/mj-hegar-leads-the-democratic-candidates-for-u-s-senate

Today, I'm thinking about my brothers and sisters I served with and the millions more veterans who've served our country. One of the best ways we can honor them is to ensure we hand down the most stable foreign policy environment possible to the next generation of service members. Those who have served deserve legislators who will look out for them. Our government must uphold its promises to those who choose to wear the uniform, and give them the resources they need to transition back to civilian life after their service.

‪It was an honor to visit the Lee Crossley Veterans Community to see the homes that help veterans transition back to civilian life in Bell County. As a veteran, I know we need a wide range of services to meet the needs of people returning home from serving our country.‬
It's Election Day, y'all! Texans, make sure to get out and vote today. There's still plenty of time — polls are open until 7pm! You can find your polling place here: mytexasvotes.com

Thank you AFSCME Local 1624 for inviting me to join the panel at your VOTE PAC convention! We're in this fight — for the dignity of work, the right to organize, workplace safety, and so much more — together.
Happy Halloween! Trick or treat is great practice for canvassing. 🎃 Sign up here to join my team and knock doors with us to win in 2020: mjfortexas.com

I had a great visit with Southwest Pipe Trades UA 142! Thank you for inviting me to learn more about the Apprenticeship Training School and the opportunities it provides to Texans to earn a living while learning their trade.

Thank you Moms Demand El Paso for your openness and strength in sharing how your community is recovering from gun violence. Gun violence has rocked Texas, from the horrifying mass shootings in El Paso and Midland-Odessa, to suicides and domestic violence, and it's long past time to take action. We have to finally stop selling weapons of war, require universal background checks, and end open carry. I'm with you. #ElPasoStrong

Spent a great morning with labor leaders from El Paso Building Trades, hosted by @IBEW 583. We talked about modernizing the energy grid and the importance of protecting apprenticeship programs. Thanks for inviting me to meet with you to hear about your work and your union!

John Cornyn suggested it's a good idea for the U.S. to step aside and make way for ethnic cleansing. The members of our armed forces don't put on the uniform to "get out of the way” for mass slaughter of people we were just fighting beside.   If John Cornyn doesn’t have the stomach for foreign policy and national security, then he's the one who should get out the way and let those of us who do understand what it means to lead the free world take it from here.   https://www.dallasnews.com/news/politics/2019/10/24/cornyn-rivals-blast-him-for-defending-trumps-decision-to-allow-ethnic-cleansing-of-kurds-by-turkey/
I was glad to sit down with activists and community leaders in Johnson City over the weekend for a meal and great conversation. They're ready to send some real Texas values to the Senate!
What a fun morning with the folks of Kyle at their Founder's Day Parade! Thank you for welcoming my family and me to have some of that beautiful cake and celebrate with y'all.

UAW workers have been standing strong for fair wages, better treatment, and the dignity of work. I was glad to be with them yesterday, and I’m standing with them until they settle on a final agreement with GM.

Big news: Texans are standing together to Rally Against Fear tonight in the DFW area! Excited to join Beto O'Rourke and lots of great TX Dems to talk about REAL Texas values -- like courage, independence & strength. If you're ready for change in Texas, join me tonight in Grand Prairie!  https://act.betoorourke.com/event/beto-events_attend/33973?source=MJHegar

Thousands of folks have chipped in to this campaign because they are FIRED UP to finally bring some real Texas values to Washington! Thanks to our grassroots team, we're building the movement we need to win this race. We're in this together, and I won't let you down. Thank you! https://www.statesman.com/news/20191014/mj-hegar-raises-1m-in-3rd-quarter-in-senate-bid

Atatiana Jefferson should be alive. There's no excuse for her death, and words will not lessen the pain and heartbreak her family and loved ones feel. This isn't an isolated incident. For black Americans, it's far too frequent of a tragic reality. In one of the most diverse states in our country, it's not a reality we should accept. Justice must be served for Atatiana. This should not be controversial — no one is safer in an environment of distrust. We must be swift in enacting reforms to prioritize community policing and non-lethal force, increase accountability for officer-involved shootings, and commit to doing the hard work to build trust between police and the communities they serve.
So grateful to be invited to chat with the Kroger employees of UFCW 1000 in Richardson! It was empowering to hear about their work and their union.

Patients suffering from cancer, HIV, and more are being gouged for an extra $5 billion. Meanwhile, Sen. Cornyn is saying "no thanks" on a bipartisan effort to lower drug prices. It looks like Big Pharma continues to enjoy a hefty return on the $881,615 they invested into Cornyn's campaign coffers.  http://hill.cm/ULqvWor
No doubt about it, Texas is the biggest battleground state! Great to spend Saturday with Texas Democrats talking about how to win in 2020 and bring some real Texas values to the Senate.
‪Grateful for time with these wonderful Texans in Plano! Thanks to all who came out and shared their time, stories, and ideas with me!‬

I know there's a lot going on in the news right now, but I'm not going to let this slide under the radar. John Cornyn is against a bill to lower drug prices despite bipartisan support. Once again, Texans lose, while Big Pharma's $881,615 bet on Senator Cornyn continues to pay off for them -- literally. https://www.reviewjournal.com/news/politics-and-government/house-democrats-move-to-lower-drug-prices-1851664/

Winning the nation's largest battleground state won't be easy, but 2020 is our chance! Here's the bottom line: the more people we turn out this election, the more likely we are to WIN Texas. Celebrate National Voter Registration Day by requesting your registration form here:  https://webservices.sos.state.tx.us/vrrequest/index.asp

Catastrophic floods, devastating hurricanes, and rising temperatures — Texans are already hurting from the effects of climate change. For the health and safety of current and future generations, we cannot afford to wait any longer to address it. It's well past time our elected leaders admit that climate change is an existential threat, and take action to protect our state. Thank you to the young people leading the way! https://www.cbsnews.com/live-news/global-climate-change-strike-today-2019-09-20-live-updates/

“If we don’t fight now, when are we going to fight? This is not about us. It’s about the future.” I'm standing with you in solidarity in your fight for fair wages, affordable health care, and dignity for workers, UAW. Our economy is strongest when it works for everyone! https://dfw.cbslocal.com/2019/09/16/north-texas-workers-nationwide-strike-against-gm-contract-dispute/

Waco, it’s always a pleasure! Loved having the chance to answer questions and exchange ideas with these wonderful people, before attending the Richards-Jackson Dinner in honor of trailblazers Gov. Ann Richards and Waco Mayor Mae Jackson.

Let this Hispanic Heritage Month be a triumphant celebration of what makes our state of Texas, and our country, great! Texas is proof that a multicultural community guarantees a vibrant state. We are stronger and better thanks to the vast and varied contributions of Hispanic people.
Great to be in Houston with Dems from the Bay Area and Friendswood. They're fired up for this election and ready to WIN!

I was a young lieutenant in the Air Force when the September 11th attacks shook our country. The days that followed deepened my understanding of the importance of strong alliances. I know our country will face challenging times again, and we must work to maintain relationships around the world so we can count on our allies to stand by us. May we never forget. More of my thoughts here: https://fortune.com/2018/09/11/september-11-terrorism-allies/

As a mother, a Texan and a responsible gun owner, I'm asking John Cornyn to put politics aside and take the needed actions to protect our communities. We are Texas, and we’re in this together.  Read my open letter to John Cornyn here: https://www.tribtalk.org/2019/09/09/an-open-letter-to-john-cornyn/
‪I had a great time in Erath county! Loved talking with these Texans about what matters to them in this election at the wonderful Burger Joint at Graham Central Station. Thanks for coming out!‬
Glad to spend time with some great folks in both North & East Lubbock talking about health care, climate change, labor, and how to get people voting!

Happy for the chance to sit down with some young leaders in the Lubbock community. We talked a lot about education (Carolyn is an assistant school principal), gerrymandering, community development, environmental justice & more. Grateful for their ideas and perspectives!

John Cornyn allowed $38.5 million to be ripped from projects aimed at improving conditions at Fort Bliss and Joint Base San Antonio, letting down Texans in uniform to fund a border wall that experts acknowledge will do NOTHING to improve national security.  https://www.npr.org/2019/09/04/757463817

One mass shooting after another, politicians like Gov. Greg Abbott and Sen. John Cornyn acknowledge there's a problem but lack the courage to do anything about it. Texans deserve leaders brave enough to stand up to the special interests and party bosses and take action to protect Texans.

I lost my stepdad — who raised me like a father — to a workplace accident, and it devastated my family. Because to the workplace safety standards won by the labor movement, fewer families have to go through the turmoil mine did. While we celebrate this Labor Day with picnics and parades, let's remember all we have to thank the labor movement for: the weekend, the 8-hour workday, workplace safety standards, and more. Workers of all backgrounds and walks of life have been key to building America’s prosperity and creating a fairer, safer workplace. As senator, I’ll stand with workers by protecting our progress & our right to organize, and ensuring the voices of working people are heard.

Had a great time in West Texas yesterday meeting with voters in Sweetwater and Abilene! Even had a chance to swing by the National WASP WWII Museum honoring the trailblazing women Air Force pilots who came before me.

Had a blast with the National Treasury Employees Union Chapter 247 in Austin! Great to celebrate a strong union like this one just ahead of Labor Day. Thanks for welcoming me (and my kids) last night!

We have to take meaningful steps toward equality if we expect to see change. That’s why I fought to repeal the Ground Combat Exclusion Policy barring women from elite military jobs, and fought to help more working parents be able to afford child care while running for office.  This Women's Equality Day, my hat’s off to those partnered with me along the way, and all those making strides to accomplish true, lasting progress toward equal pay, reproductive health freedom, and so much more!‬

The generosity of our state shines through in this story. Groups like Team Brownsville are showing the best in us. I also met a Brownsville woman who had arranged with a local restaurant to give her extra food to deliver to folks at the border. So many Texans are coming together to do good. But we need policy change! Asylum seekers at our Southern border should receive the same treatment and due process as any other asylum seekers do in our country.  https://valleycentral.com/news/local/volunteers-feeding-over-500-migrants-in-mexico-daily

The right to vote is the core of our democracy. Half the people of our state are not having their voices heard on election day, and it’s high time we address the problem. When Texans have their voices heard our leadership will be more representative of Texas.  https://www.texastribune.org/2019/07/25/texas-voting-rights-share-your-problems-us/

#TitleX helps families plan for their futures, and provides critical health care like contraceptives, cancer screenings, and annual exams. Planned Parenthood serves 40% of Title X patients. This gag rule is dangerous and will hurt people seeking health care. Women lose their lives if they can’t access early detection or be told all their medical options when facing complicated pregnancies. As senator, I’ll stand firm against any attacks on women’s health services and ensure women have access to quality, affordable care.  https://www.keranews.org/post/planned-parenthood-out-title-x-over-trump-rule
Great to spend my Sunday on the road meeting folks in New Braunfels and Kyle yesterday!

These ICE raids sow chaos and pain and do not make us safer. We need comprehensive immigration reform, including a path to citizenship for the undocumented that reflects our American values, prioritizes national security, and keeps families together. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/mississippi-ice-raid-11-year-old-girl-tearfully-begs-for-dads-release-after-massive-raid/

Getting on the road and talking to Texans inspires me and gives me hope during especially heavy times. It gives me hope to hear from you about what matters, and the future you see for Texas. Thank you for the warm welcome yesterday, Dallas.

El Paso is one of our oldest Texas cities. A warm, welcoming, and diverse place full of good people. These are the faces of our Texas. #ElPasoStrong  https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/lamvo/el-paso-texas-shooting-victims-walmart

My heart is breaking for the victims, families, and members of the El Paso community affected by this horrific attack. This is devastating and senseless. Thank you to first responders taking action. https://abcnews.go.com/US/police-el-paso-issue-report-active-shooter/story?id=64753896

This week marks 10 years since my helicopter went down in Afghanistan. I've been reflecting a lot on the meaning of service and the need for more decision makers who understand the cost of war themselves.  I've also thought a lot about my brothers and sisters who were with me, and how we worked together to complete our mission and get to safety. Our government could take some cues from what we learn in the military: unity, teamwork, and a shared mission is the only way to succeed. As a combat veteran, I believe war can and should be avoided through successful diplomacy. And while there truly are some things worth fighting for, we have a responsibility to the next generation that will wear our uniform: to give them the most stable environment we can. Thank you to our men and women in uniform serving and sacrificing around the world and at home, past, present, and future. May you ever rely on the assurance that you are only called away from your families when your country needs you most.

"She's very dynamic. She's delivering a message we've all hungered for." Dallas is ready for change! I spent time yesterday talking with voters about my plans and ideas. I'm excited to keep sharing my message across Texas in the months ahead of this campaign!  https://www.dallasnews.com/news/elections-2020/2019/07/24/mj-hegar-invades-rival-royce-wests-turf-says-fighter-needed-take-republican-john-cornyn

I met a lot of great folks yesterday at the ML Edwards & Co General Store in Mt. Vernon. We talked about the need to make vocational schools a priority, and make community and state colleges more accessible. Wendy shared with me the challenges her family faced getting affordable health care coverage for their child with a disability - and it reminds me that our fight to protect health care is far from over. Thank you all for joining me for coffee, and sharing your stories and priorities with me. I’ll take them with me to DC!

I visited the Casa del Refugiado in El Paso yesterday, where I met families fleeing violence to provide a better and safer life for their children. Their stories were often heartbreaking, but always hopeful. These kids had so much spirit despite the challenges behind and ahead of them.  The families I talked with came here in search of safety and refuge, and also because they believe in the same American dream that makes me so proud to have served this country. I was moved by their stories because, as a mother, I would do anything to keep my children safe.  Annunciation House is one of the many organizations extending humanitarian aid to families like the ones I met. They run shelters including the Casa del Refugiado, and they need our help. You can donate to them here: https://bit.ly/2XO6aFu However, we can’t rely on charitable organizations to carry the weight of our broken immigration system. Our federal government MUST end the traumatizing treatment at detention centers, and take decades overdue action toward comprehensive immigration reform.

John Cornyn will have to answer to the millions of Texans with any one of these pre-existing conditions whose health care he's sold out again and again. He's claimed he can come up with something better than the Affordable Care Act, but actions speak louder than words, and after almost a DECADE we’re still waiting. Instead, he’s sold Texans out to Mitch McConnell and the insurance industry trying to rip away our health care. He was even labeled the “Top Salesman” of a bill that would have slashed pre-existing condition protections and increased costs for Texans by $2,000 on average!   Today, two judges he backed for the U.S. Court of Appeals heard arguments in a case that could increase costs and gut key protections for Texans. It could devastate the insurance marketplace, and once again Cornyn and McConnell have NO plan. Texans deserve to know we won’t be denied insurance for a pre-existing condition, and no Texan should have to fight a terrifying battle against disease while worrying about going bankrupt. We deserve better than this.
Had a great time celebrating today at Fredericksburg's annual Fourth of July parade! Thanks for having me!

As we celebrate Independence Day with family and friends, let’s take a moment to reflect on what it symbolizes. America was founded on the principles of life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. Our country came to symbolize the promise of these rights to the world.  I believe deeply in that promise. It’s why I felt called to serve my country in the Air Force, why I fought for women’s right to compete for ground combat jobs, and why I’m running for Senate. But at a time when many are alarmed by the conduct of our representatives, and troubled by what we see on the news, we have to remember our American values and commit ourselves to fighting to uphold them for ALL people.  So today, while I celebrate America with family, friends, and fellow Texans, I’m also recommitting myself to fight each day to protect what our great country represents to the world. I hope you’ll join me in a moment of reflection -- and have a safe and happy 4th of July!
